resources.string: "Not Saved. Unfortunately The Data could not be Saved. Please check messages for the reason(s)."
The name of the Store you are adding goes here.
Used to distinguish Stores with the same name
Street Address (to distinguish this from other Stores with the same name)
The Street address of the Store goes here.
City/Suburb (again to distinguish this from other Stores of the same name
City, Suburb or Locality of the Store goes here.
The State, Region, County or District in which the Store is located goes here.
The phone number of the Store goes here. Note! you are not restricted to numbers.
Any notes you wish to make regarding the Store can go here.

Select the appropriate option:- 

	EDIT to change the Store details. 

	STOCK to add products to the Store. 

	BACK to return to the Store List. 

			Note! STOCK option will not be present when a Store has no Aisles.

Select the appropriate option:- 

	EDIT to change Store details. 

	BACK to return to the Store List.

\
Please confirm, by clicking DELETE, that you want to Delete Store:-\n\t

Note! This will delete Aisles and underlying Produce in the Store. 

		The produce is only removed from the Aisles not from the list of Produce. 

		However, store specific information for the Produce, such as the cost, will be deleted.

A Store cannot be added without a Name. 

Please enter a Name and then click on the Save button. 

Note! The Store name is the only required field, all the other fields can be omitted.
Do you wish to Add Aisles to Store:-\n\t
Store where the Aisle is Located
The name of the Aisle you are adding goes here.
Order of the Aisle (lower numbers come first, default is 1000)
Cannot add Aisle as the Aisle Name has not been given.\n\nPlease enter an Aisle Name and then click on the Save button.

Select the appropriate option:- 

	EDIT to change the Aisle details. 

	STOCK to add products to the Aisle. 

	BACK to return to the Store List.
Store has no Aisles - Products cannot be added.

has no aisles! 

Do you wish to add Aisles? 

Note! if you choose to Cancel, then you should select another Store.
Do you really want to Delete AISLE:-\n\t
Product (Select Store/Aisle and Product, then click add)
The name of the Product you are adding goes here.
Any notes you wish to make regarding this product can go here.
Product cannot be added as a name has not been given. \n\nPlease enter a Product Name and then click on the Save button.
Edit Product or Add Product to an Aisle

Select the appropriate option:- 

	EDIT to change the Product 

	STOCK to add the product to an Aisle in a Store 

	BACK to return to the Product List
Do you really want to DELETE Product:-\n\t
Note! The following fields should only be changed if you understand the consequences.
Rule Name is required. Please provide a name for the Rule.
Frequency is required. Please provide a frequency from the Spinner(Dropdown) . Note! should never get this.
Click Delete to confirm Deletetion or Click Cancel.
Prompt when adding rule to Shoppling List?
Shopper - Store List (click Store to Edit, long click to Delete)
Shopper - Aisle List by Store (click Aisle to Edit, long click to Delete)
Shopper - Product List (click Product to Edit, long click to Delete)
Do you wish to Add Rule :-\n
\n\nClick Add to Add, Otherwise Click Skip.

No Products (things to buy) exist. 

Shopper requires at least 1 product. 
would't be very useful if there was nothing to buy! 

After you click on CONTINUE you will be able to add a product (more if you wish). 

The minimum requirement for a product is the name of the product. 

Notes only serve to assist you. 

Hint!! When adding products it could well be useful to be quite comprehensive. 
As an example Baked Beans come in many brands and sizes, so rather than simply naming the product Baked Beans, it may be better to do something like Baked Beans - Heinz - small. You also have to consider the length of the product name so being concise will also be to your advantage. 
Once you have entered the product name and notes if you want to then clicking on the Save button will save the product and then allow you to add another product. 
The DONE button, not available until a product has been added, will allow to continue. Note! any data that you have typed, since the last SAVE will not be saved.

No Stores exist. 

Shopper requires at least 1 Store. 

After you click on CONTINUE you will be able to add a Store or Stores. 

At a minimum you need the a Store name (it cannot be blank). 

Order will defaut 1000 if you do not input a value. 
	Order determines order in which the shopping list appears; where lower ordered Stores appear first. 

Street, City, State, Phone and Notes are not required. 
	Street appears frequently and can be useful for distinguishing Stores in a chain or group. 
	City appears frequently and can be useful for distinguishing Stores in a chain or group. 

State, Phone and Notes are for your convenience. 

When you have finished inputting the Store information click on the SAVE button. 

Using multiples of 1000 to define the order gives a great deal of scope to add/insert subsequent Stores without having to change multiple Store Orders to order them according to your requirements. 
If you don't feel like adding data for the other fields (Street, City, State, Phone No. and Notes) then click on the SAVE button without inputting the data. 

When you click on the SAVE button the store will be saved but the screen will remain (although the information that you typed will be cleared and the hints shown). 
There will be a new button, DONE. Clicking this will allow you to continue. Note! any data you have typed, since the last SAVE will not be saved.

Click on the Add button to add a Store. 
Click on Done button to return/go back. 

Click on a Store in the list to either :- 
	a) Edit the Store or 
	b) Stock the Store (Add products to the Store) 
		Note! You can only Stock a Store if the Store has at least 1 Aisle 
			and there is at least 1 Product 

Long Click on a Store in the list to Delete the Store 
	Note all Aisles and thus all Products in those Aisles will be deleted. 
	The Products would remain as Products in produce.

Input or Amend the Store Name, Order, Street, City, State, Phone and Notes as required. 
Click the Save button to add/amend the Store. 
Alternately Click the Done button to return/go back. 

Store Name is required in order to Save the new/changed Store. 
All other fields are optional. However, City and Street can help distinguish Stores with the same name. 
State, Phone and Notes are for your convenience.

Click on the ADD button to Add an Aisle. 
Click on DONE to return/go back to the Main/Initial Screen. 
Use the Store Selector to select the Store that you want to work with. 
	This will list the Ailses in that Store and also set the Store when adding an Aisle 

Clicking an Aisle will allow you to:- 
	a) Edit the Aisle or 
	b) Stock the Aisle (ie Add products to the Aisle) 

Long Clicking an Aisle will allow you to Delete the Aisle. 
	This removes product assignements to the Aisle, it does not delete the Product. 

Note the term Aisle is used loosely, it can be an area, department part of an Aisle or 
 even something else (refer to flexibility in the manual for more information).

Select the Store to which you want to add an Aisle using the dropdown selector. 
Input or Amend the Name you wish to give the Aisle and the Order (this will default to 1000 if not input). 
Finally Click on the Add Button to add the new Aisle. 
The Aisle should now appear in the list of Ailses currently in the Store. 

Note the term Aisle is used loosely, it can be an area, department part of an Aisle or 
 even something else (refer to flexibility in the manual for more information).

Click on the Done button to return to the main/initial screen. 
Click on the Add button to Add a Product. 

Click on a Product in the list to either :- 
	a) Edit the Product (Change the Name or Notes)or 
	b) Stock to add the product to an Aisle 

Long Click on a Product to Delete a Product. 
	NOTE if you Delete a Product then that Product will be removed from all Store Aisles

Input/Amend the Product\'s name and notes (notes are not required) and then click on the Save button. \nWhen complete click on the Done button to return/go back. \n\tNote when adding the first Product the Done button is not available until a Product is added.

Select Store, Aisle and Product, then input Price and Order, then Click Add to add the product to that Store/Aisle. \nClick on a Product already in this Store/Aisle to Edit the Product, Long Click to delete.

Amend the Price and/or the Order and then Click on the Save button to make changes. 
Click on the Done button to return/go back. 

	Note! in Developer Mode the More/Less buttons reveals or hides additional input. 

		Amending these additional fields, unless experienced, can result in un-desired results.

Click on an Item in the list to Add it to the Shopping List 
	Note that the Item is added immediately and that 1 is added. To add more of the same Item repeat. 

Filter List by inputting Product or Store data. 
	e.g. Entering b in the Product input, will then only show Products that have b or B in them. 
		Likewise for the Stores input. 

Done will return/go back. 

Use the Shopping button from the Main screen to view the Shopping List.

Rule Name is required. 
Prompt will default to not prompting before adding rule 
	(done when Shopping is selected from Main display). 
Start Date is requireed and must be in the format dd/mm/yyyy 
	(note dd and mm can be single digit). 
Frequency is used in combination with Multiplier (e.g. Days 2 = every 2 Days). 
Quantity, which defaults to 1, specifies how many of the product are to be purchased. 

Click on Save to save the rule. 
	You can then add additional rules for the same product/aisle/store combination. 
Click Done to return to the Product/Current Rule List.

This is the Shopping List 
Click on the respective Bought button when you have picked an Item. 
	Repeat for each Item if you have a quantity greater than 1 Items. 
	The Item's text will change to white when all have been picked. 

Click on Adjust to change an Item, Quantity, Cost and Product Name can be changed. 

Click on Delete to remove an Item from the Shopping List. 

Click on Trim to remove completed/picked (theorectically purchased) Items. 
	Note this, unlike Delete, retains a historical record of the Item(s) having been purchased.

Adjustments 
Click on +1 or -1 buttons to increment or decrement the Quantity respectively. 
The Quantity can also be entered into the New Quantity field. 
Change the Cost by entering the new value into the New Cost field. 
Change the Product Name by entering the new value into the New Product field. 

Click the SAVE button to Save new values. 
Click the RESTORE button to revert to the Original values. 
	Note the Original values are displayed above the Actions heading. 
Click the DONE button to return to the Shopping List. 
	Note, remember to Save before clicking DONE.

Prompted Rules Exist. 
 Please click on Add or Skip for all listed entries. 
Add will add the entry into the Shopping List 
Skip will not add the entry into the shopping list. However, the next occurrence wil be determined. 
When All listed entries have been actioned the Shopping List will be displayed.

Displays 2 lists. Products that are in Aisles and the Current Rules. 

Filter Products by inputting Product and/or Store data. 
Click on a listed Product to Add a Rule for that Product. 

Click on a listed Rule to Edit the rule. 
Long Click on a listed Rule to Delete the rule. 

Both lists can be Sorted by clicking on the Heading Labels.
Create a copy of the actual database file.
Restore database from a copy of the actual database file.
Create SQL to build and load a database.
Clone, delete, rebuild and reload Database from SQL Backup.
Restore data from a Shopper data dump
Save a table in Comma Separeted Values format.

Filenames are generated by combining the base filename with a system generated date/time portion and a file extension. In that order. 

	It is recommended that you follow the provided naming convention. However, all three parts can be adjusted. 

	It is the base filename that is used to determine the appropriate restore/import files. Hence, why it is recommended to not change the base filename, as it may hide some files. 

	The date/time portion will be in the format _YYMMDD_hhmm.

Developer mode increases the amount of data available to the user. 
Two developer specific buttons are made available from the main/initial screen :- 
	The Data button shows Database data. 
	The Schema button displays the Database Schema. 
Logging activity is increased. 
Additional information will also be avaialble to the user in the form of toasts and on screen information.

Allow Rule Suggestions allows for the suggestion of rules based upon recorded purchases. 

By allowing rule suggestions a list of products, if any meet the criteria, will be displayed with a suggestion for the frequency. 

The criteria are: 
	The product was first purchased at least 90 days ago and, 
	that no rule exists for the product. 

This used in association with the Rule Suggestion Frequency setting (below).

Rule Suggsetion Frequency determines how often Rule suggestion, if not turned off, will be checked. 

The value is the number of days between checks and defaults to 30. 
That is approximately on a monthly basis.
Next Rule Suggest from When Done

Determines the next Rule Suggestion Date/Time by adding the FREQUENCY to the Date/Time when the Suggestion was actioned. 
	Otherwise, the next Rule Suggestion will be from the suggested Date/Time. 

Example, if FREQUENCY is 7 (weekly) and a month since Shopper was last used; 
	If unchecked, Rule Suggestion would be done 4 or 5 times. However, once only if checked.
You can diasble help displays throughout Shopper. \nOverall this will give a more display space. \nIt is only advisable to disable help displays when you are comfortable with using Shopper.

This determines what backups are listed. 
If checked then backup files listed will have to have be comprised of both the specified BaseFileName AND the specified File Extension. 

If unchecked the backup files listed can have either the specified BaseFileName OR the specified File Extension. 

The former, the default, is the safest, as it reduces the chance of selecting the wrong type of file.
ID - Order - Store Name - Street (2nd Line) City - Phone (3rd Line) Notes
ID - Store ID - Order - Aisle Name
ID - Product Name - (*)Order - (*)Aisle - (*)Uses - Notes (* inidcates unused)
Aisle Ref - Product Ref - Cost - Buy Count - First Use date - Last Use Date - Min Cost
Id - Name - Type - Prompt - Period - Multiplier - ActOn - ProductRef - AisleRef - Uses - MinCost - MaxCost
Id - Name - Type - Prompt - Period - Multiplier - ActOn
ID - ProductRef - DateAdded - NumberToGet - Done - DateGot - Cost - ProductUsageRef - AisleRef
ID - Name - Type - IntVal - RealVal - StrVal - Flag
